sourceMeaningMnemonic: The <radical>leader</radical>'s <radical>key</radical> is the key that <kanji>make</kanji>s all the other keys. It's sort of like the one ring to rule them all, the one ring to bind them... except with keys.
meaningInfo: Imagine the leader taking his key to open up a safe that has a button to make other keys for the underlings. No key is as great as this key, though.
readingMnemonic: The leader <kanji>make</kanji>s all the keys and puts them in a <reading>sack</reading> (<ja>さく</ja>) to distribute them to the underlings, who then <reading>saw</reading> (<ja>さ</ja>) them into shape.
readingInfo: Imagine the leader making the keys and dropping them one by one into a big sack. He's always walking around carrying a big sack over his shoulder, distributing the keys to his underlings and watching them saw them into shape.
